Directives > ui-file-upload

ui-file-upload

Note: as there is no back-end service for the ui-elements page, all the file uploads in this section will fail. You should still be able to see the functionality around uploading files and thumbnails.
Click to Upload

Drop files here 

<ui-button size="small" id="somebutton">Click to Upload</ui-button>
<br/><br/>
<div id="dropzone" 
     style="width: 150px; 
           height: 150px; 
           border: 1px black solid; 
           padding: 10px; 
           background-color: lightyellow; 
           margin-bottom: 10px;">
    Drop files here
</div>
<ui-file-upload project-id="someProjectId" 
                success="doSomething(fileId)" 
                failure="handleFileUploadError(response)" 
                dropzone-id="dropzone" 
                is-dialog=false accept="image/*"
                acceptFileExtensions="jpg,png"
                upload-button-id="somebutton">
    <ui-file-upload-items style-class="uploadElement" 
                          width="250" 
                          height="250">
    </ui-file-upload-items>
</ui-file-upload>

ui-file-upload Options

Name type description
project-id string The unique identifier of the project into whose document store the files will be saved.
success function The callback function to be invoked when the associated file was successfully uploaded. This callback function will pass back the response from the document upload.
failure function The callback function to be invoked when the associated file was not successfully uploaded. This callback function will pass back the response from the document upload.
file-start function The callback function to be invoked when the associated file was starting to upload. This callback will pass back the file object of the file being uploaded.
invalid-files function The callback function to be invoked when files of an invalid type have been attempted to be uploaded. The callback method will be invoked with a list of files that were rejected.
upload-start function The callback function to be invoked when files are started upload. This callback takes no parameters.
dropzone-id string An optional parameter that identifies the DOM element that is to be used as a dropzone for file drag and drop. If no dropzone id is provided, the complete body of the document is used as the dropzone.
is-dialog boolean Indicates if the file upload component is contained with in a dialog window.
accept string Specifies the types of files that the upload component can accept. E.g. "image/*", "text/html". If not provided, all file types are accepted.
acceptFileExtensions string Specifies the file extensions that the upload component can accept. Can be used in conjunction with the "accept" parameter, where the mime type fails to be retrieved, or can also be used in isolation.
upload-button-id string The unique identifier of a DOM element that, when clicked, will display the file upload dialog. There is a limitation that prevents this from working when placed on Anchor () tags. Also due to the nature of how an input field is injected into the DOM when using uploadButtonId, be aware that the input will take on the id and classes of the element it's placed within.
upload-url string The optional url that may be provided to determine the upload service to be used for the uploading of the files. If supplied, this parameter will override the projectId parameter otherwise used to determine the back end service.
ui-file-upload-items
Name type description
style-class string The CSS class to be used for rendering the containing div for each of the elements currently being uploaded. Note: The styleClass must have position: relative set so that the progress bar displays correctly.
width string The required width of the containing div for each of the elements being uploaded. This is needed to generate the correct size thumbnail when the upload is of an image type.
height string The required height of the containing div for each of the elements being uploaded. This is needed to generate the correct size thumbnail when the upload is of an image type.
